discussion.author: StefanKarpinski
discussion.text: The abbreviation is a bit on the terse side. Would you consider something longer?

discussion.author: ethanmatlin
discussion.text: We'd like to keep it SMC if possible. We'll make it clear in the description, documentation, and other advertising what it's intended to be used for. Thanks!

discussion.author: fredrikekre
discussion.text: `SequentialMC` would be an alternative, since the abbreviation `MC` is quite well known. Anyway, we can merge this as is, just wanted to offer an alternative.

discussion.author: FRBNY-DSGE-Team
discussion.text: Thanks for the suggestions. Although the name is perhaps not ideal, we've already committed to it for other reasons so we'd like to merge as is with the current name. Thanks!

discussion.author: fredrikekre
discussion.text:
Sure. Btw, does it not support Julia 1.0, 1.1, 1.2 etc? You probably mean to have
```toml
[compat]
julia = "0.7, 1"
```
?

discussion.author: ethanmatlin
discussion.text: Currently, it only supports 0.7 but we're planning to change that soon.
